AllowInsecureRequests

Whether non-SSL requests should be allowed. Defaults to disabled. In the default state, http:// requests will be automatically converted to https://.

public bool AllowInsecureRequests { get; set; }

Property Value

bool

Remarks

Setting this overrides the OSU_INSECURE_REQUESTS environment variable.

Methods

Abort()

Forcefully abort the request.

public void Abort()

AddFile(string, byte[])

Add a new FILE parameter to this request. Replaces any existing file with the same name. This may not be used in conjunction with AddRaw(Stream). GET requests may not contain files.

public void AddFile(string name, byte[] data)

Parameters

name string

The name of the file. This becomes the name of the file in a multi-part form POST content.

data byte[]

The file data.

AddHeader(string, string)

Adds a new header to this request. Replaces any existing header with the same name.

public void AddHeader(string name, string value)

Parameters

name string

The name of the header.

value string

The header value.

AddParameter(string, string)

Add a new parameter to this request. Replaces any existing parameter with the same name.

If this request's Method supports a request body (POST, PUT, DELETE, PATCH), a Form parameter will be added; otherwise, a Query parameter will be added. For more fine-grained control over the parameter type, use the AddParameter(string, string, RequestParameterType) overload.

Form parameters may not be used in conjunction with AddRaw(Stream). 

public void AddParameter(string name, string value)

Parameters

name string

The name of the parameter.

value string

The parameter value.

Remarks

Values added to the request URL query string are automatically percent-encoded before sending the request.

AddParameter(string, string, RequestParameterType)

Add a new parameter to this request. Replaces any existing parameter with the same name. Form parameters may not be used in conjunction with AddRaw(Stream).

public void AddParameter(string name, string value, RequestParameterType type)

Parameters

name string

The name of the parameter.

value string

The parameter value.

type RequestParameterType

The type of the request parameter.

Remarks

Values added to the request URL query string are automatically percent-encoded before sending the request.

AddRaw(byte[])

Adds a raw POST body to this request. This may not be used in conjunction with AddFile(string, byte[]) and AddParameter(string, string, RequestParameterType).

public void AddRaw(byte[] bytes)

Parameters

bytes byte[]

The raw data.

AddRaw(Stream)

Adds a raw POST body to this request. This may not be used in conjunction with AddFile(string, byte[]) and AddParameter(string, string, RequestParameterType) with the request type of Form.

public void AddRaw(Stream stream)

Parameters

stream Stream

The stream containing the raw data. This stream will not be finalized by this request.

AddRaw(string)

Adds a raw POST body to this request. This may not be used in conjunction with AddFile(string, byte[]) and AddParameter(string, string, RequestParameterType).

public void AddRaw(string text)

Parameters

text string

The text.

GetResponseData()

Retrieve the full response body as an array of bytes.

[CanBeNull]
public byte[] GetResponseData()

Returns

byte[]

The response body. Can be null if the request hasn't yet Completed, or if it has been Aborted.

GetResponseString()

Retrieve the full response body as a UTF8 encoded string.

[CanBeNull]
public string GetResponseString()

Returns

string

The response body. Can be null if the request hasn't yet Completed, or if it has been Aborted.

Performs any post-processing of the response. Exceptions thrown in this method will be passed to Failed.
